correction_response: This tweet is partially misinformed. While systemic racism is a pervasive issue, the specific details of the Rittenhouse case are misrepresented. Rittenhouse did not cross state lines with a firearm; the gun belonged to a friend and never left Wisconsin (https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/crime/2020/08/26/wisconsin-open-carry-law-kyle-rittenhouse-legally-have-gun-kenosha-protest-shooting-17-year-old/3444231001/). He is also claiming self-defense, asserting he feared for his life during the incident (https://abcnews.go.com/US/kyle-rittenhouse-trial-ahmaud-arbery-case-expected-hinge/story?id=80687642). The trial's outcome will be determined by a jury, not the justice system as a whole (https://www.reuters.com/world/us/prosecutors-face-tough-test-trial-us-teenage-protest-shooter-rittenhouse-2021-10-28/). It's important to separate the specifics of this case from the broader issue of systemic racism.
